_header: As I find written of a king / That never would laugh…
_description: The Melancholy King, in the Northern Homily Cycle — in couplets

BodAsh42.First Lines:
Als i finde writen of a kingeþat neuer wald laghe for no
                    gladdinge…
BodAsh42.Last Lines:
…And bringe vs to thi blisseful beldeþat tholemodemen
                    wiþ þe sall welde
BodAsh42.Editions:
Thompson,  Anne B.,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Homily
                    Cycle.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008.

CULGg531.First Lines:
Als I fynd wryten of a kyngÞat neuer wald laugh for na
                    gladdyng…
CULGg531.Last Lines:
…And bryng vs to þat blissefull beldeÞar tholmode
                    men with þe sall welde

BLHar2391.First Lines: Als I fynd wrytyn of a kyngþat neuer wyld lagh for no gladdyng…
BLHar2391.Last Lines: …And bryng vs to þi plysful w beyldþat tholemode men with þe schall weyld
BLHar2391.Note: Penultimate line has “w” written and crossed through before “beyld”; ends “Amen.”
BLHar2391.Attributed Title: Dominica infra octava ascencionis (left margin, f. 192v) with “A tale” written below

Lam260.Editions:
Rosenthal,  Constance Lowegrund. 
             The Vitae Patrum in Old and Middle English Literature.
         Philadelphia, 1936; repr. Folcroft, PA: Folcroft Library,
            1974: 155.
